Neither Cryos International, nor PBL, interfered with the study design, data collection, analyses, decision to publish or preparation of the manuscript. The authors emphasize that their conclusion that “implementation of quarantine for a donor shown to shed a herpesvirus is not a tenable solution” indeed runs against the commercial interest of Cryos International. Finally, none of these “commercial interactions” alter the authors’ adherence to the PLOS ONE policies on sharing data and materials.
